lines.text: I guess if the earth were made of gold, men would die for a handful of dirt.
It's a good trick, and it'll work.
On who?
On me because I'm stayin' with you.
Why?

[Chuckles]
Because I'm a fool.
Not to me.

[Hesitatingly]
What am I to you?
Maybe it'll help if I tell you.
It won't.
It's easy to say because you're nothing. You're nothing at all. Just nothing.
She's tryin' to prove that one of us is a hero or a fool or both.

[Grabbing Fiske's arm as he walks away from him]
I'm talkin'! Don't you turn your back on me!

[Slapping away Daly's hand]
You're right, Daly. A man should never turn his back on you, not if he cares about something happening.
What is she trying to prove?
That one of us is a hero or a fool.
Well, anyway, it's her funeral. I don't go to any but my own.
A cross isn't a bad thing to see...it can be beautiful. And everybody has one.
[Fiske and Hooker are watching a lovely cantina singer singing in Spanish]
I've found that pretty women speak the same language all over the world.
What about the ugly ones?
Never listened.
Say, Hooker, before you became an idiot lookin' for gold, what were you?
An idiot without it.
Whew! Isn't there some other way we could go back?
Not that I know of.

[Sarcastically]
Great! How'd you ever find this place?
With a map from an old priest in Sacramento. He warned us against it.
What'd he come here for?
For God! A little better reason than ours, wasn't it?
Takin' four men like us to a mountain of gold!
She took what there was.
Yeah, that's true. The barrel was empty. She scraped the bottom.

[Seeing Leah feeding sugar to her horse]
Look, you see that? Before this is over, you'll be just like that horse, eatin' right out of her hand.
Maybe it isn't the woman. Maybe it's the sugar.
Vicente is marking the trail.
Yeah.
You think he might wanna make this trip again?
He just might wanna get back from this one.
Believe nothing a woman says, but everything she sings.
Who told that?
Me.
